responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application allows user-supplied data to be rendered on the page without proper sanitization or encoding. This could potentially lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks where an attacker injects malicious scripts into the application, which will be executed by the victim's browser.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - IdentityOAuthConfigTools.createDataUrl
    filenames:
      - api/src/main/java/com/xwiki/identityoauth/internal/IdentityOAuthConfigTools.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential External Control of File Name vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application allows user-supplied data to be used as a file name when uploading files or attachments. An attacker could potentially upload malicious files or exploit path traversal vulnerabilities by providing crafted file names.
    cwe: CWE-434
    function_names:
      - IdentityOAuthUserTools.fetchUserImage
    filenames:
      - api/src/main/java/com/xwiki/identityoauth/internal/IdentityOAuthUserTools.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential Use of Hard-coded Credentials vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application appears to use hard-coded credentials in the `DefaultIdentityOAuthProvider` class. Hard-coded credentials in the codebase can lead to potential security vulnerabilities if these credentials are compromised or leaked.
    cwe: CWE-798
    function_names:
      - DefaultIdentityOAuthProvider.initialize
    filenames:
      - api/src/main/java/com/xwiki/identityoauth/internal/DefaultIdentityOAuthProvider.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential Improper Input Validation vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application does not seem to validate user-supplied input properly in various places, such as when processing the OAuth return, fetching the authorization code, and processing the OAuth start. This could potentially lead to injection vulnerabilities or other security issues.
    cwe: CWE-20
    function_names:
      - IdentityOAuthManager.processOAuthReturn
      - IdentityOAuthProvider.readAuthorizationFromReturn
      - IdentityOAuthManager.processOAuthStart
    filenames:
      - api/src/main/java/com/xwiki/identityoauth/IdentityOAuthManager.java
      - api/src/main/java/com/xwiki/identityoauth/IdentityOAuthProvider.java
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application allows user-supplied data to be rendered on the page without proper sanitization or encoding. This could potentially lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks where an attacker injects malicious scripts into the application, which will be executed by the victim's browser.

leads.headline: Potential External Control of File Name vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application allows user-supplied data to be used as a file name when uploading files or attachments. An attacker could potentially upload malicious files or exploit path traversal vulnerabilities by providing crafted file names.

leads.headline: Potential Use of Hard-coded Credentials vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application appears to use hard-coded credentials in the DefaultIdentityOAuthProvider class. Hard-coded credentials in the codebase can lead to potential security vulnerabilities if these credentials are compromised or leaked.

leads.headline: Potential Improper Input Validation vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application does not seem to validate user-supplied input properly in various places, such as when processing the OAuth return, fetching the authorization code, and processing the OAuth start. This could potentially lead to injection vulnerabilities or other security issues.
